size: 15 x 21 cm
title: Paul Cézanne

size: A French symbolist painter, printmaker, draughtsman and pastellist.
title: Odilon Redon

size: A French Post-Impressionist painter in the Naïve or Primitive manner.
title: Henri Rousseau

size: A French Post-Impressionist artist who was not well appreciated until after his death.
title: Paul Gauguin

size: A major Post-Impressionist painter.
title: Vincent van Gogh

size: A French artist who gained renown for his Neo-Impressionist paintings and drawings.
title: Charles Angrand

size: A Belgian neo-impressionist painter.
title: Georges Lemmen

size: A French painter and printmaker.
title: Henri-Edmond Cross

size: A French Post-Impressionist painter and draftsman.  He is noted for his innovative use of drawing media and for devising the painting techniques known as chromoluminarism and pointillism.
title: Georges Seurat

size: A Belgian neo-impressionist painter, who played a pivotal role in the European art scene at the turn of the century.
title: Théo van Rysselberghe

size: A French Neo-Impressionist painter who, working with Georges Seurat, helped develop the Pointillist style.
title: Paul Signac

size: A French painter, printmaker, draughtsman and illustrator whose immersion in the colourful and theatrical life of Paris in the late 19th century yielded a collection of exciting, elegant and provocative images of the modern and sometimes decadent life of those times.
title: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

size: A French painter who was a pioneer of abstract art and an inspiration for the avant-garde Nabis movement, Synthetism and Cloisonnism.
title: Paul Sérusier

size: A French painter and writer.
title: Paul Ranson

size: A French Post-Impressionist painter and writer, who had artistic friendships with Vincent van Gogh, Paul Gauguin and Eugène Boch,[1] and at a later time, Paul Cézanne.
title: Émile Bernard

size: A a Swiss/French painter and printmaker associated with Les Nabis. He was an important figure in the development of the modern woodcut.
title: Félix Vallotton

size: A French painter and printmaker associated with the Nabis.
title: Édouard Vuillard

size: A a French painter and printmaker, as well as a founding member of the Post-Impressionist group of avant-garde painters Les Nabis.
title: Pierre Bonnard

size: A prolific French Neo-impressionist artist, known for his paintings, illustrations, engravings, and graphic art, and also for his anarchist activism.
title: Maximilien Luce

size: A French Post-Impressionist landscape painter of the Rouen School (l'École de Rouen) who was born and spent most of his life in France.
title: Robert Antoine Pinchon

size: A French painter who practiced genre painting, portraits, nudes and landscapes, treating the subjects of the daily life and intimists subjects.
title: René Schützenberger
